law.catch_line: Whenever any county among the geographical subdivisions of this State, as that term is defined in §...

text.section: Whenever any county among the geographical subdivisions of this State, as that term is defined in § 4 of Article XI-A of the Constitution of the State, shall have adopted for itself a charter or form of government under the provisions of said Article XI-A of the Constitution, it shall be entitled to exercise the following express powers in addition to the powers codified in Article 25 of the Code, title "County Commissioners".

Notwithstanding the provisions of this section, the subtitle "Draining Lands" of Article 25 of the Code applies to a county that adopts a charter form of government under the provisions of Article XI-A of the Constitution.
